slide.title: Among those arrested were at least three vets and several meat dealers, including one based in Narbonne in southwestern France who is suspected of being the ringleader of the illicit trade, police sources said. Sanofi said in a statement that the company was cooperating with the investigation into “possible fraud” and that it had sold around 200 horses in the last three years, generally to veterinary colleges, individuals or horse centres.
